content: page 1 of 6 bird mask written and designed by the twisted hatter rewriting or selling any portion of this pattern is prohibited this includes making a video tutorial you may of course sell the finished product but listing it for sale using my photos is not allowed i designed this mask because i wanted something to put crafty intensions eastern dragon pieces on for the pieces i used her add on pattern an i hook 5 50mm a 5mm for the horns and 2 strands of yarn the pieces fit perfectly for me but you may need to play around with your hook size depending on your gauge i don t know the yardage needed i sewed the pieces on the same way you would on the dragon this pattern hasn t been tested so good luck butter cups lol if you have any questions regarding this pattern please join my crochet fb group https //www facebook com/groups/998677850555703/ page 2 of 6 size one size materials you will need i highly recommend using caron one pound or any stiff/sturdy yarn yarn yarn size color brand used approx substitute your own yds worsted weight 4 white caron one pound 360 g hook 4mm you can use a larger hook but the finished product will be larger and possibly floppy scissors yarn or tapestry needle stitch markers stitch guide please read this to avoid questions chain chain double_crochet double_crochet st/sts stitch/stitches 2tog decrease between 2 stitches slip_stitch slip_stitch join is also a slip_stitch fo fasten_off bb back bump the bump under the v on a chain bp back post half_double_crochet half_double_crochet fp front post pattern notes please read me do not count beginning chains unless instructed when working in row the 1st stitch of the row is worked in the last st of prev row the st the chain emerges from unless instructed not to when working in rnds the 1st stitch is worked in the same st chain emerges from unless instructed not to when you see anything between *-*3x repeat that sequence the amount of times specified when i cc change color i join yo with new color & pull through to cc if you have a preferred method feel free to do it that way *the entire pattern is worked double stranded gauge using 4mm hook & 2strands 11 half_double_crochet + 8 row= 3 page 3 of 6 mask *refer to pattern notes for 1st st placement in rnds & row *beginning chains are not counted *place a st marker in your fp/bp double_crochet if necessary to see what st to work in you will use the same hook and 2 strands for the entire mask using g hook 4mm & 2 strands of white yarn row 1 chain 2 half_double_crochet in 2nd bb chain 1 turn 1 row 2 2hdc in st chain 1 turn 2 row 3 half_double_crochet in 1st st 2hdc in nxt st chain 1 turn 3 row 4 2hdc in 1st st half_double_crochet
